gurmukhi: ਅਤਿ ਅਾਤਰ ਕਿਅਾ ਕਹਿ ਸਕੈ ਬਿਧਯੋ ਕਾਮ ਕੇ ਤੀਰ ॥੨੩੪॥
transliteration: At(i) Aatar Keeaa Kah(i) Sakai Bidhyo Kaam Ke Teer||234||
translation: The king became greatly agitated but because of the attachment with the winsome wife and under the impact of the god of love (Kamdev), he could not say anything.234.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਬਿਧਿ ਪਰ ਪਾੲਿਨ ਰਹੇ ਮੋਰੇ ਬਚਨ ਅਨੇਕ ॥ ਗਹਿਅੳੁ ਹਠਿ ਅਬਲਾ ਰਹੀ ਮਾਨਯੋ ਬਚਨ ਨ ੲੇਕ ॥੨੩੫॥
transliteration: Bahu Bidh(i) Par Paain Rahe More Bachanndanek|| Gadh-au Hath(i) Ablaa Rahimaanyo Bachanndan Ek||235||
translation: The king in many ways holding the feet of the queen to back out from his promise, but that woman, showing her weakness (of fair sex) persisted in her demand and did not accept any request of the king.235.

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਦਯੋ ਮੈ ਛੋਰੇ ਨਹੀ ਤੈਂ ਕਰਿ ਕੋਟਿ ੳੁਪਾੲਿ ॥ ਘਰ ਮੋ ਸਤੁ ਕੳੁ ਦੀਜੀਅੈ ਬਨਬਾਸੈ ਰਘੁਰਾੲਿ ॥੨੩੬॥
transliteration: Bar Dyo Mai Chore Nahitain Kar(i) Kottee Oupaae|| Ghar Mo Sat(u) Kau Deejeeai Banbaasai Raghuraae||236||
translation: “I shall not leave you without getting the boons, though you may make millions of efforts. Give the kingdom to my son and exile Ram.”236.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਪ ਧਰਨ ਬਿਨ ਬੁੱਧਿ ਗਿਰਯੋ ਸੁਨਤ ਬਚਨ ਤ੍ਰਿਯ ਕਾਨ ॥ ਜਿਮ ਮ੍ਰਿਗੇਸ ਬਨ ਕੇ ਬਿਖੈ ਬਧਯੋ ਬਧ ਕਰਿ ਬਾਨ ॥੨੩੭॥
transliteration: Bhoop Dharan Bin Buddh(i) Giryo Sounat Bachanndtriya Kaan|| Jim Mriges Ban Ke Bikhai Badhyo Badh Kar(i) Baan||237||
translation: Hearing these words of his wife, the king became unconscious and fell down on the earth like a lion pierced by arrow in the forest.237.

gurmukhi: ਤਰਫਰਾਤ ਪ੍ਰਿਥਵੀ ਪਰਯੋ ਸੁਨਿ ਬਨ ਰਾਮ ੳੁਚਾਰ ॥ ਪਲਕ ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਤਯਾਗੇ ਤਜਤ ਮੱਧਿ ਸਫਰਿ ਸਰ ਬਾਰ ॥੨੩੮॥
transliteration: Tarphraat Prithvidaryo Soun(i) Ban Raam Ouchaar|| Palak Praan Tyaage Tajat Maddh(i) Saphar(i) Sar Baar||238||
translation: Hearing about the exile or ram the king writhed and fell down on the earth like the pining of the fish out of water and breathing her last.238.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਸ੍ਵਨਨ ਸੁਣਯੋ ੳੁਠਿ ਥਿਰ ਭਯੋ ਸੁਚੇਤ ॥ ਜਨੁ ਰਣ ਸੁਭਟ ਗਿਰਯੋ ੳੁਠਯੋ ਗਹਿ ਅਸ ਨਿਡਰ ਸੁਚੇਤ ॥੨੩੯॥
transliteration: Raam Naam Sravnan Sounyo Outh(i) Thir Bhayo Souchet|| Jan(u) Ran Soubhat Giryo Outhyo Gad(i) As Needar Souchet||239||
translation: Hearing again the name of Ram the king came to his senses and stood up like a warrior becoming unconscious and falling in war and standing up again holding his sword after becoming conscious.239.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਪਤਨ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਬਰ ਸਹੋ ਧਰਮ ਨ ਛੋਰਾ ਜਾੲਿ ॥ ਦੈਨ ਕਹੇ ਜੋ ਬਰ ਹੁਤੇ ਤਨ ਜੁਤ ਦੲੇ ੳੁਠਾੲਿ ॥੨੪੦॥
transliteration: Praan Patan Nrip Bar Saho Dharam Na Chhodhaa Jaae|| Dain Kahe Jo Bar Houte Tan Jout Dae Outhaae||240||
translation: The king accepted death rather than abandonment of his Dharma and the boons which he had promised, he granted them and exiled Ram.240.
The speeches of Kaikeyi and the King.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਪਯਾਨੋ ਬਨ ਕਰੈ ਭਰਥ ਕਰੈ ਠਕੁਰਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Raam Pahaano Ban Darai Bharath Darai Thakuraae||
translation: “Exile Ram and give the kingdom to Bharat;

gurmukhi: ਬਰਖ ਚਤਰ ਦਸ ਕੇ ਬਿਤੇ ਫਿਰਿ ਰਾਜਾ ਰਘੁਰਾੲਿ ॥੨੪੧॥
transliteration: Barakh Chatar Das Ke Bite Phir(i) Raajaa Raghuraae||241||
translation: After fourteen year Ram will again become the king.”241.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੀ ਬਸਿਸਟ ਸੁਧਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਰਘੁਬਰ ਸੋ ਜਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Kahibasist Sudhaar Kar(i) Sriraghoubar So Jaae||
translation: Vasishtha said the same thing to Ram in an improved way,
